meanings.definition: Coaxed or persuaded with flattery or kind words.
meanings.sent1: She blandished her friend into sharing the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent2: He blandished his way into getting a discount at the store.
meanings.sent3: The salesman blandished the customer into buying the expensive watch.
meanings.sent4: The politician blandished the voters with promises of a better future.
meanings.sent5: The teacher blandished the students to participate in the class activity.

meanings.definition: Flattered or praised in order to persuade or influence.
meanings.sent1: They blandished the celebrity to attend their event.
meanings.sent2: She blandished her boss to get a promotion.
meanings.sent3: The children blandished their parents to buy them a new toy.
meanings.sent4: The artist blandished the critics with her latest masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: He blandished his way into the exclusive club with his charm.

meanings.definition: Persuaded or influenced through flattery or kind words.
meanings.sent1: The blandished child easily agreed to do his homework.
meanings.sent2: She felt special after receiving the blandished compliments.
meanings.sent3: The blandished puppy wagged its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: The blandished audience applauded the performer enthusiastically.
meanings.sent5: The blandished student felt encouraged to pursue his dreams.
